ovdesc.p: This screen is used to set the status of a received message manually. A record authorised in this screen will create or amend or delete a record in store table, PPT.RECEIVEDFILEDETAILS

desc.p: Identifies the type of file received from the clearing system.
Distinguishes between payment files and message files.
Unique ID generated by the payments hub in order to identify each record in the application.
Specifies the format of the message received from a channel.
Specifies the number of children or individual transactions present in a batch or a clearing file respectively.
Used for internal purpose. Holds the ID of the previous live record of store table.
This field can hold upto 65 alphanumeric characters and the value is not editable by the user.
Specifies the channel through which the payment hub receives a message.
SWIFT – Society for Worldwide Interbank Financial Transactions.This channel is used for international payments worldwide.
PMTROUTER – Payment Router. This channel is used only by our Bank.
CEC – Centre for Exchange and Clearing
HKICL – Hong Kong Interbank Clearing Limited
The value links to the field ‘ChannelName’ in PPT.CHANNEL.
Specifies the common reference shared by all transactions of a bulk message as parsed from the actual message received.This field can hold upto 128 alphanumeric characters.
Global Batch Identifier value such as 89139020225698

Contains all the override messages which the user agreed to during Input. During the validation of a transaction, the system may provide the user with a series of screen override messages to indicate an anomaly.
Indicates the name of the queue in which a message is received.
Specifies the status of ACK/NACK message generated for the payment.
Holds the timestamp at which a message is received from any of the channels in the payments hub.
Indicates the type of a message.
Specifies the company ID as specified in the message. This value may or may not be present in the message.
Indicates the current status of the payment file.
ACCEPTED - Message has been validated and accepted.
REJECTED - Message has been validated and rejected.
REPAIR - Message has been validated and put to repair for manual intervention.
RESUBMIT - Message is repaired and submitted again for validation.
MAPPED - Message is mapped successfully and necessary payment order is created.
CANCELLED - Message is cancelled by either the payments hub or by an operator.

MAPPINGERROR - A bulk message has encountered a mapping issue and a payment order could not be created. This status is set only when a parent payment of a batch message has encountered an issue at mapping stage.

MAPPEDWITHERROR - A bulk message has encountered a mapping issue and a payment order could not be created. This status is set only when a child payment of a batch message or any payment of a clearing message has encountered an issue at mapping stage.
MAPPINGERRORFIXED - Mapping issue has been rectified and the message has been mapped manually by the operator.
Holds the actual ACK/NACK generated for the payment.
This field will hold a value only when ACKNACKGeneratedIndicator is "G" or "S"
Used for internal purpose. Value of this field determines values of fields, 'RAC' and 'RSC'
This field can hold upto 1 alphanumeric character and the value is not editable by the user.
Indicates the company ID for which the record is created.
The value links to the field ‘CompanyID’ in PPT.COMPANY
Used for internal purpose.Holds the ID of the current live record of store table.
This field can hold upto 65 alphanumeric characters and the value is not editable by the user.
Contains a value only when a payment file has been rejected based on certain validation.
The value is an error code as defined for the error scenerio in PPT.ERRORCODE
Contains a value only when a payment file has been rejected based on certain validation.
Holds a value only when a file is received from Clearing. This field has the name of the file as received from the clearing system.
Denotes the unique ID generated by the payments hub upon receiving a message from an external system.
This field can hold upto 50 alphanumeric characters generated by the system
